intro: Tarenna cameronii, commonly known as Cameron's tarenna, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the island of Madagascar and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. Its fruits are berries that contain several seeds, and it is often found in moist, shaded forest environments. Tarenna cameronii is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
